text: Ismat Makhmudovich Khushev (Uzbek: Ismat Khushev; Russian: Исмат Хушев; born 20 June 1958) is an author, politician, journalist, and a political analyst from Uzbekistan. He is a former member of the Uzbek Parliament and a cabinet member of former Uzbek President Islam A. Karimov. ==Personal life== Khushev was born on June 20, 1958 in Kashkadarya, Uzbekistan. He's married and has four children. He was educated in Moscow State University and Tashkent State University at the Department of Journalism. After being arrested 3 times due to allegedly being involved in a coup d'état after opposing Karimov, Khushev fled to Moscow, Russia, and then sought permanent residence in Canada. Khushev is the founder and chief editor of the Uzbek & Russian newspaper Dunyo Uzbeklari, electronically published from Toronto, Canada. ==References== Category:Living people Category:Uzbekistani journalists Category:1958 births Category:Moscow State University alumni Category:National University of Uzbekistan alumni
title: Ismat Xushev
